title: Bank of England says UK inflation has peaked after leaving interest rates on hold at 4% – business live
summary: Bank of England governor Andrew Bailey clarified the decision behind the 5-4 vote to keep borrowing costs steady. He emphasized the need for caution amid economic uncertainties and inflation concerns. The split vote reflects differing views among policymakers on the appropriate monetary policy direction.

title: Lammy says spike in mistaken prison releases is ‘unacceptable’ and welcomes Billy Smith’s return to jail – UK politics live
summary: Smith, 35, was sentenced to 45 months in prison for various fraud offenses on Monday. However, due to an error, he was released from custody the same day. Authorities are currently addressing the mistake and considering next steps.

title: USMNT’s Pochettino admits he misses Premier League and would like to return in future
summary: United States men's national team coach Mauricio Pochettino expressed nostalgia for the Premier League and a desire to return to the league in the future. He highlighted his fondness for his previous experiences in the Premier League. Pochettino's comments sparked speculation about his potential career moves.

title: India beat Australia by 48 runs in fourth men’s Twenty20 international – live reaction
summary: Australia collapsed to 119 all out, losing 9 wickets for just 52 runs in their T20 match on the Gold Coast. India's strong performance in the third match has given them a 2-1 lead in the series. Only one match remains to determine the series winner.

title: Bank of England holds interest rates as it warns joblessness on rise
summary: Policymakers have maintained borrowing costs at 4%, signaling concerns about ongoing weak economic growth. They emphasize the need for careful fiscal management ahead of an important budget decision. The focus remains on addressing economic challenges while balancing financial stability.
